page.title: 06A Farmworkers Story
page.content: Imaginary Conversation-Lincolnshire Dialect "Ah-do maate, a'yu allrayt? I 'ed a rayt owd do yistday. We'd bin wokkin down t'fen, pickin' taates, an' it wa' that squaddy I wa' ommust farwelted bi naite, an' di'nt knaw 'ow to traail me-sen 'ooam. I gor on me bike wi' a few taates in me bag, an' just got gooin' up t'fen when me cheen brok on me bike, an' dang me!, I run slap in t'dayk. I picked me-sen up, wi' watter runnin' out me clooas, an' walked 'ooam. The missus was throng weshin' t'floor, an' when she see me on t'corsey covered wi' squad, she bealled out-"Weer hivver e'ye bin? To the pub bi the looks on yer. Tek yer clooas off i'the wesh-house." I dossn't tell 'er me lunch bag wor in t'bottom o' yon dayk."
